title: Hard Sauce
ingredients: ½ cup superfine or confectioners’ sugar
instructions: Cream the butter until it’s pale, light, and fluffy.  Beat in the sugar and lemon zest until well mixed.  Gradually add the brandy, beating constantly until well blended and then chill.
remarks: Serve the hard sauce, lightly chilled, with hot plum pudding, mince, or pumpkin pie. The hard sauce may be made up to 3 weeks before it’s used.  Seal it in a jar and store it in the refrigerator. To make “Rum Butter” use soft brown sugar instead of confectioners’ sugar, use orange zest instead of lemon, and use rum instead of brandy. Yield:  Makes about 1 cup. Source:  Harrods Cookery Book by Marilyn Aslani, Arbor House, New York, © 1985 by Marilyn Aslani and the National Magazine Co. Ltd.
